About Me

A few things about myself:

BIO

Prior to my passion for coding, I was a clerk, barista, and freelance illustrator. Wanting to do more with myself to help others, I embarked on my journey to become a full stack developer. I can contribute to teams through my illustration background, education in psychology, and freshly developed coding skills to design aesthetic and intuitive applications for users to enjoy.

Trilogy Education

Course Assistant
  • • Teach full stack web development fundamentals to class of 50 adult students over the course of an intensive 6-months with over 250+ hours of in-class teaching
  • • Encourage students to think independently, read and understand documentation, and develop problem solving skills to cultivate their independence.
  • • Work closely with individual students during office hours
  • • Debug and grade coding homework assignments and projects which includes the following: - JavaScript (including ES6) - HTML5 - CSS3 - Bootstrap - jQuery - Node.js and NPM - MongoDB - MySQL - React - Git - GitHub - Heroku - Express - Java - Firebase - ORMs - Responsive design and more

Envision Blockchain Solutions

Blockchain Development Intern
  • • Developed the Front-end UI for supply chain management using the Microsoft Azure Blockchain workbench.
  • • Participate in weekly code reviews with Co-founders and 2 other developers
  • • Work remotely to design the navigation and display of blockchain contracts using React, CSS and Semantic-UI.

Givergy

Tech Manager
  • • Deploy and maintain Givergy's networking equipment and tablets at fundraising events.
  • • Ensure 100+ guests can bid and donate through Givergy's fundraising software and payment through Stripe.
  • • Coordinate with clients to address issues and requests to provide best-service possible to average more than $50,000 raised per event.
